Articles.Content:
f-22 raptor

> 
> here it is a beautifull render done by esinohio 
> 
> check his others works here [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/111540-Show-off-your-KSP-Blender-Renders!/page17](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/111540-Show-off-your-KSP-Blender-Renders!/page17)
> 
> ![28G8uiz.png](http://i.imgur.com/28G8uiz.png)
> 
> 

All stock

Hi! I managed to recover somehow my 0.9 F-22, i had to use 4 engines (2 clipped) for obtain a decent sea level speed (about mach 1).

She is realistically manouverable with a Maximum G of 10-11.

Warning, fuel consuption is really high due the 4 engines, but there is enough time to have some fun with it, sorry guys but this is the best i could do with 1.0 without change too much the aesthetic of the craft from 0.90.

The most accurate replica i could build of this awesome plane, she respect at 95% the proportions of the real one.

comparison of the real F-22 raptor blueprints with my build

![H7sYTcJ.png](http://i.imgur.com/H7sYTcJ.png)

youtuber Guard13007 did a review of this craft! check it here

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/5mUZJQpHIPo?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

His channel:

[https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZZ-RBp_D-a-JIuKDykhegA](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZZ-RBp_D-a-JIuKDykhegA)

Parts: 212

CONTROLS

-1 toggle engines

-0 toggle hidden ladder

-4 open/close missile bay (only esthetical in this stock version)

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/1wlcd)

VERY IMPORTANT

Before take off click on the small probe clipped inside the front nosecone and select: CONTROL FROM HERE, this will adjust the horizon of the craft, modified due the angled cockpit. If you switch to IVA you need to reset control from here.

![QWoPwFa.png](http://i.imgur.com/QWoPwFa.png)

![3M74KpG.png](http://i.imgur.com/3M74KpG.png)

[DOWNLOAD](http://www./download/881pj8lnvfm9n2l/f-22_raptor_by_Eorin_1_0.craft) Stock version

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-08T11:23:48Z" title="05/08/2015 11:23  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 8, 2015</time> by eorin**
Beautiful as always, Eorin.

Very nice; however the cockpit and nose assembly is a bit too far forward:

[https://www.google.com/search?q=f-22+top+view&tbm=isch&imgil=ZZkkPRnT2KSB0M%253A%253B-6buucJafMaqgM%253Bhttp%25253A%25252F%25252Fwww.af.mil%25252FNews%25252FArt.aspx%25253Figphoto%2525253D2000790798&source=iu&pf=m&fir=ZZkkPRnT2KSB0M%253A%252C-6buucJafMaqgM%252C_&usg=__p0i_RV3B7PqMtI1h6QMzzjjHIpg%3D&biw=1280&bih=952&ved=0CCgQyjc&ei=nwcWVYnPNsabNo-sgLAF#imgrc=ZZkkPRnT2KSB0M%253A%3B-6buucJafMaqgM%3Bhttp%253A%252F%252Fmedia.dma.mil%252F2006%252FJul%252F05%252F2000790798%252F-1%252F-1%252F0%252F060705-F-ZZ000-453.JPG%3Bhttp%253A%252F%252Fwww.af.mil%252FNews%252FArt.aspx%253Figphoto%253D2000790798%3B1722%3B1260](https://www.google.com/search?q=f-22+top+view&tbm=isch&imgil=ZZkkPRnT2KSB0M%253A%253B-6buucJafMaqgM%253Bhttp%25253A%25252F%25252Fwww.af.mil%25252FNews%25252FArt.aspx%25253Figphoto%2525253D2000790798&source=iu&pf=m&fir=ZZkkPRnT2KSB0M%253A%252C-6buucJafMaqgM%252C_&usg=__p0i_RV3B7PqMtI1h6QMzzjjHIpg%3D&biw=1280&bih=952&ved=0CCgQyjc&ei=nwcWVYnPNsabNo-sgLAF#imgrc=ZZkkPRnT2KSB0M%253A%3B-6buucJafMaqgM%3Bhttp%253A%252F%252Fmedia.dma.mil%252F2006%252FJul%252F05%252F2000790798%252F-1%252F-1%252F0%252F060705-F-ZZ000-453.JPG%3Bhttp%253A%252F%252Fwww.af.mil%252FNews%252FArt.aspx%253Figphoto%253D2000790798%3B1722%3B1260)

> Very nice; however the cockpit and nose assembly is a bit too far forward:
> [https://www.google.com/search?q=f-22+top+view&tbm=isch&imgil=ZZkkPRnT2KSB0M%253A%253B-6buucJafMaqgM%253Bhttp%25253A%25252F%25252Fwww.af.mil%25252FNews%25252FArt.aspx%25253Figphoto%2525253D2000790798&source=iu&pf=m&fir=ZZkkPRnT2KSB0M%253A%252C-6buucJafMaqgM%252C_&usg=__p0i_RV3B7PqMtI1h6QMzzjjHIpg%3D&biw=1280&bih=952&ved=0CCgQyjc&ei=nwcWVYnPNsabNo-sgLAF#imgrc=ZZkkPRnT2KSB0M%253A%3B-6buucJafMaqgM%3Bhttp%253A%252F%252Fmedia.dma.mil%252F2006%252FJul%252F05%252F2000790798%252F-1%252F-1%252F0%252F060705-F-ZZ000-453.JPG%3Bhttp%253A%252F%252Fwww.af.mil%252FNews%252FArt.aspx%253Figphoto%253D2000790798%3B1722%3B1260](https://www.google.com/search?q=f-22+top+view&tbm=isch&imgil=ZZkkPRnT2KSB0M%253A%253B-6buucJafMaqgM%253Bhttp%25253A%25252F%25252Fwww.af.mil%25252FNews%25252FArt.aspx%25253Figphoto%2525253D2000790798&source=iu&pf=m&fir=ZZkkPRnT2KSB0M%253A%252C-6buucJafMaqgM%252C_&usg=__p0i_RV3B7PqMtI1h6QMzzjjHIpg%3D&biw=1280&bih=952&ved=0CCgQyjc&ei=nwcWVYnPNsabNo-sgLAF#imgrc=ZZkkPRnT2KSB0M%253A%3B-6buucJafMaqgM%3Bhttp%253A%252F%252Fmedia.dma.mil%252F2006%252FJul%252F05%252F2000790798%252F-1%252F-1%252F0%252F060705-F-ZZ000-453.JPG%3Bhttp%253A%252F%252Fwww.af.mil%252FNews%252FArt.aspx%253Figphoto%253D2000790798%3B1722%3B1260)

I completely disagree. Eorin basically got the shape of the F-22 raptor almost perfect. There are some areas of the craft where he traded smoothness for shape, but that's not the point. His positioning is definitely correct. Sorry, but:

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/Bkx3S)

First pic is real life f-22 over Eorin's, second is the same with the actual f-22 of real life at 50% opacity.

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

Ohh, and Eorin, feel free to use the images to show off how good your building skills are.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-28T02:22:23Z" title="03/28/2015 02:22  AM" data-short="9 yr">March 28, 2015</time> by manni01**
nice but i would put some smal control surface's over the engine's to get the f22 engine shape

@manni01

You're right; it must be the nose cone shape that threw me off!
Its ok. The nose of the F-22 is impossible to recreate in KSP anyways (I'm talking realistically without an f-22 the size of KSC and a ridiculous amount of parts)

Actually, stock revamp modifies the NCS adapter to look a bit better, and stacking a inline cockpit then a toroidal 8 tank then the stock revamp NCS adapter, then offsetting the NCS adapter down a bit gives you this:

![7gzVoiU.png](http://i.imgur.com/7gzVoiU.png)

> 
> Actually, stock revamp modifies the NCS adapter to look a bit better, and stacking a inline cockpit then a toroidal 8 tank then the stock revamp NCS adapter, then offsetting the NCS adapter down a bit gives you this:
> [http://i.imgur.com/7gzVoiU.png](http://i.imgur.com/7gzVoiU.png)

I meant stock, but that actually looks really good though.

It really looks great. I have not seen a replica that accurate before for quite a while. That being said I really am wondering about the actual in-game performance of the craft. Also I think it could use a customized cockpit with an ejector seat.

Don't take those criticisms negatively. This is *awesome*. The sharpened nose cone especially.

> 
> nice but i would put some smal control surface's over the engine's to get the f22 engine shape

I've tried (you can see that in the work in progress thread), but the surfaces caused trouble with the engines probably for exaust collision, then i've chosen a more simple way to go, for now.

Btw thx manni01 for your comparison pictures!

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> It really looks great. I have not seen a replica that accurate before for quite a while. That being said I really am wondering about the actual in-game performance of the craft. Also I think it could use a customized cockpit with an ejector seat.
> Don't take those criticisms negatively. This is *awesome*.

it handles like all my planes if you have ever tried one of them ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> I've tried (you can see that in the work in progress thread), but the surfaces caused trouble with the engines probably for exaust collision, then i've chosen a more simple way to go, for now.
> Btw thx manni01 for your comparison pictures!

> it handles like all my planes if you have ever tried one of them ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Only if KSP had the same levels of thrust vectoring as the Raptor has....
Almost ready to be released

> 
> Only if KSP had the same levels of thrust vectoring as the Raptor has....

F-22 has only pitch (2d) thrust vectoring I believe. Not sure about the precise angles tho.

But I don't think handling is the first priority here anyway

And it does look really close indeed.

Also at 1.0 release this cockpit will have a new EVA pretty cool news for this craft (among others).

I agree that the engines are the weak spot and need a bit of additional work to look closer to the P&W F119 (maybe 4 small flaps that move when you pitch?)

![SNF11_F-22_Heat-Waves.jpg](http://airpigz.com/storage/hi-res/SNF11_F-22_Heat-Waves.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-28T17:24:36Z" title="03/28/2015 05:24  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 28, 2015</time> by RevanCorana**

> 
> F-22 has only pitch (2d) thrust vectoring I believe. Not sure about the precise angles tho.
> But I don't think handling is the first priority here anyway

already tried the 4 small flaps, they don't work due to engine exaust collision. Aniways... download link added on the main post, small modifications on the looks, some adjustements. Added even a BD armory version with 4 sidewinders inside the missile bay and a vulcan cannon.
Haha.. ok, wow. This is even better than your PAK-FA.

UPDATE! modified the engines so you can be happy now u.u it looks more like a trhust vectoring engines, plus now she has more range 300fuel more. See main post, the download links are replaced, the BD armory version too.

here it is a beautifull render done by esinohio 

check his others works here [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/111540-Show-off-your-KSP-Blender-Renders!/page17](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/111540-Show-off-your-KSP-Blender-Renders!/page17)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-01T16:23:47Z" title="04/01/2015 04:23  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 1, 2015</time> by eorin**

Fantastic replica, I think this is more accurate than either my F-15 or my A-10, both of which consumed a lot of hours of build time so I know exactly how much work has gone into this.

I will have to look into stock revamp, a lot of those hours were spent on noses and empennages (although then they wouldn't be stock anymore so... maybe not! ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) )

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-02T03:15:03Z" title="04/02/2015 03:15  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 2, 2015</time> by allmhuran**
Looks brilliant! Unfortunately for me it doesn't fly very well using Ferram Aerospace.

Incredible. Looks amazing and actually flies very well in unmodded Kerbal.

Fast, agile, lots of fuel, looks great, stock. Definitely envious of this top echelon craft. Reps for you.
Beautiful!
